title: Antisemitism is real , but exaggerating it hurts our children – The Forward
message:
Antisemitism Notebook Your weekly guide through the news and the noise of how rising antisemitism and disputes over how to address it are shaping American Jewish life.
And we are creating a climate of polarization which causes many Jews to feel attacked from all sides.
a Jewish state built atop an existing non-Jewish population, where Jews enjoy legal privileges) and hating Jews.
So of course Jews feel attacked when they see Israel being attacked.
But again, my focus is on helping young American Jews feel more confident and resilient.

title: Theyre going loco , Trump says of pro - Palestine protesters
message:
A 95-year-old Auschwitz survivor was among guests at an event in New Jersey Thursday night as former President Donald Trump launched following recent attacks on members of the Jewish community.
"They're going loco," Trump said of pro-Palestine protesters, using the Spanish word that means crazy or unhinged.
It’s with the Republican Party, and with President Donald J. Trump," the release continued.
"'Jewish Voices for Trump' comes together with one voice, to make sure that President Donald J. Trump becomes the next President of the United States."
Trump, meanwhile, reportedly suggested Vice President Kamala Harris “doesn’t like Jewish people” even though her husband, second gentleman Doug Emhoff, is Jewish.

title: Trump Launches Coalition to Fight Antisemitism , Says Pro Hamas Protesters  Going Loco  | The Jewish Press - JewishPress . com | David Israel | 12 Av 5784 – Friday , August 16 , 2024
message:
Photo Credit: Gage SkidmoreOn Thursday night, in Bedminster, New Jersey, former President Donald Trump launched a coalition to fight antisemitism, responding to recent attacks on members of the Jewish community.
In stark contrast to the radical, hateful Democrats, President Trump remains the most ardent champion of the Jewish community and friend to the State of Israel.
Back then, the Jewish Voices for Trump coalition was co-chaired by Dr. Miriam Adelson, the late Sheldon Adelson, Wayne Berman, Boris Epshteyn, and Julie Strauss Levin.
We are focused on galvanizing the Jewish community for President Trump’s re-election.
By re-affirming our support for President Trump, Jewish voices across the country are working to deliver President Trump a second term and put a stop to radical antisemitism.

title: Trump says rise in antisemitism reminds him of the Holocaust – The Forward
message:
By Jacob Kornbluh August 15, 2024Former President Donald Trump rallied his Jewish supporters at his golf club in Bedminster, New Jersey on Thursday, blaming the Biden-Harris administration for the rise in antisemitism.
Antisemitism Notebook Your weekly guide through the news and the noise of how rising antisemitism and disputes over how to address it are shaping American Jewish life.
The Harris campaign called those accusations “absurd.” Walz is also facing backlash over his association with an imam who promoted a movie about Adolf Hitler and praised Hamas after Oct. 7.
“President Trump deserves the full support of the entire Jewish people,” Adelson said in her introduction.
Courting Jewish votersEarlier on Thursday, the Trump campaign announced the launch of the “Jewish Voices for Trump” coalition.

title: American comedian Reginald D Hunter embroiled in antisemitism incident at Fringe Festival
message:
Police are investigating a report of a "hate incident" at Hunter’s "Fluffy Fluffy Beavers" show at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival.
Two Israeli audience members were reportedly booed as they exited the show, following a joke comparing Israel to an abusive partner.
ADVERTISEMENTUS comedian Reginald D Hunter has issued a statement saying there had been an "unfortunate incident" at his Edinburgh Fringe gig, following reports two Israeli audience members were reportedly heckled out of his show.
Police are investigating a report of a "hate incident" at Hunter’s "Fluffy Fluffy Beavers" show at Assembly George Square Studios.
The stand-up comedian issued a statement, saying: "There was an unfortunate incident in my new show "Fluffy Fluffy Beavers".

title: A Law - Of - The - Land Event From Agudah | The Jewish Press - JewishPress . com | Chaim Yehuda Meyer | 12 Av 5784 – Friday , August 16 , 2024
message:
Among the speakers was Martin Handler, a local individual who had been indicted for alleged daycare fraud in the Bronx.
The Aleph Institute is dedicated to meeting the needs of Jewish inmates, but as Rabbi Chaim Dovid Zwiebel, president of Agudah, stated, the night’s event was to help with “preventative pidyon shevuim,” assisting people in avoiding jail time in the first place.
The Aleph Institute’s Project 432 helps adults and children alike learn business halacha and make the right choices in life.
Additionally, the secular media has produced page after page on negativity in our world; we need not give them fuel.
Hopefully, Agudah’s event will serve as a lesson and inspiration for all.

Former US President and Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump claimed on Thursday night that the hostages being held by Hamas in Gaza “are largely dead”, though he did not say if he had any proof of this.
These are very savage people.”He criticized Vice President Kamala Harris, saying she was considering an arms embargo on Israel.
“Under no circumstances should a radical extremist who flirts with an embargo against Israel ever become commander-in-chief of the US military.
They have to have a right to win the war,” declared Trump, adding, “And I will give Israel the support that it needs to win, but I do want them to win fast.
When a college student accused Israel of ethnic genocide, Kamala said that she was glad that the student made that comment.

title: Trump Says Civilian Award He Gave To Donor  Much Better  Than Medal Of Honor
message:
Former President Donald Trump said Thursday the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian honor, was “much better” than the Congressional Medal of Honor, the nation’s highest military decoration, because soldiers who receive the latter had to be severely injured or killed to receive it.
“I watched Sheldon sitting so proud in the White House when we gave Miriam the Presidential Medal of Freedom,” Trump said, speaking about Sheldon Adelson.
“That’s the highest award you can get as a civilian, it’s the equivalent of the Congressional Medal of Honor, but civilian version.”“It’s actually much better because everyone gets the congressional Medal of Honor, that’s soldiers, they’re either in very bad shape because they’ve been hit so many times by bullets, or they’re dead,” he went on.
But she got the Presidential Medal of Freedom.”Trump: When we gave her the Presidential Medal of Freedom… It’s the equivalent of the Congressional Medal of Honor— it’s actually much better because everyone who gets the Congressional Medal, they’re soldiers.
Former President Donald Trump greets Miriam Adelson during an event on combating antisemitism at Trump National Golf Club on Thursday in Bedminster, New Jersey.

title: Police review  hate incident  at Reginald D Hunter Edinburgh Fringe show
message:
Police investigating a report of a "hate incident" have said "no crime" was established after two Israeli audience members were reportedly heckled out of Reginald D Hunter's Edinburgh Fringe show.
The US stand-up comedian issued a statement on Thursday following reports two people were booed out of his Fluffy Fluffy Beaver show at Assembly George Square Studios over their objection to a joke about Israel.
A Police Scotland spokesperson said: "We were made aware of a hate incident, which reportedly took place at an event in Edinburgh on Sunday 11 August 2024.
Image: File pic: PAIn his statement posted to social media, Hunter said: "There was an unfortunate incident in my new show Fluffy Fluffy Beaver.
Be the first to get Breaking News Install the Sky News app for freeHunter and the Edinburgh venue have been contacted for additional comment.

title: No crime  found by police at Reginald D Hunter comedy gig amid Israel row
message:
On Thursday, Hunter said he regretted an “unfortunate incident” at his Fluffy Fluffy Beavers Edinburgh Festival Fringe show at Assembly George Square Studios.
A spokeswoman for the venue said: “We are aware of two members of the audience choosing to leave Reginald D Hunter’s performance on Sunday August 11.
A promotion poster for his comedy shows was banned with London Underground saying at the time it was “likely to offend”.
It has been reported that Currie wrote in an Instagram story warning pro-Israelis against coming to his Edinburgh Fringe shows at the Stand Comedy Club in August.
This show is not for you.”Hunter, Currie and the Stand Comedy Club have all been contacted for comment.

title: Police review  hate incident  at Reginald D Hunter Edinburgh Fringe show
message:
'No crime established' after police review 'hate incident' at Reginald D Hunter Edinburgh Fringe showPolice investigating a report of a "hate incident" have said "no crime" was established after two Israeli audience members were reportedly heckled out of Reginald D Hunter's Edinburgh Fringe show.
A Police Scotland spokesperson said: "We were made aware of a hate incident, which reportedly took place at an event in Edinburgh on Sunday 11 August 2024.
In his statement posted to social media, Hunter said: "There was an unfortunate incident in my new show Fluffy Fluffy Beaver.
The Campaign Against Antisemitism charity said the "events described at the Edinburgh Fringe are extremely concerning".
Hunter and the Edinburgh venue have been contacted for additional comment.

The Campaign Against Antisemitism charity said the "events described at the Edinburgh Fringe are extremely concerning".

title: Trump says presidential civilian award is  better  than top military honor whose recipients are  dead  or  hit  by bullets
message:
Trump says presidential civilian award is 'better' than top military honor whose recipients are 'dead' or 'hit' by bulletsTrump says presidential civilian award is 'better' than top military honor whose recipients are 'dead' or 'hit' by bulletsBEDMINSTER, N.J. — Former President Donald Trump lauded a wealthy donor on whom he bestowed the Presidential Medal of Freedom as having gotten the "better" award compared to the top military honor, the Medal of Honor, because those recipients are often deceased or injured.
“I watched Sheldon sitting so proud in the White House when we gave Miriam the Presidential Medal of Freedom," Trump said at his New Jersey resort.
It’s the equivalent of the Congressional Medal of Honor," Trump continued, referring to the highest military honor bestowed for valor in combat.
"But civilian version, it’s actually much better because everyone [who] gets the Congressional Medal of Honor, they're soldiers.
They’re either in very bad shape because they’ve been hit so many times by bullets or they’re dead," Trump concluded.

title: Pride in the face of prejudice in 2024 Paris Olympics
message:
And the blue-and-white Team Israel provided it aplenty.
Eleven members of the Israeli Olympic team were murdered by Palestinian terrorists in the Munich Massacre.
He now serves as head of the Palestinian Olympic Committee and Palestinian Football Association.
Ahead of the Paris Olympics, he sought to get the Israeli team banned.
Arad made no secret of trying to encourage her to make aliyah and compete in the Los Angeles games with Team Israel.
